dict.string: To eliminate the influence of Jews and Muslims in Spain
To spread the Catholic faith throughout Europe
To suppress Protestantism
To persecute witches and heretics
What was the ultimate goal of the Spanish Inquisition?
The Spanish Inquisition was the only manifestation of the Catholic Inquisition.
The Spanish Inquisitions begins.

The conquest of Grenada
The signing of the Treaty of Tordesillas
The Battle of Roncevaux Pass
The coronation of King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella
Which event marked the end of the Reconquista in Spain?
The Crown of Aragon played a significant role in the Granada war, providing troops and funds.
The Reconquista ends with the conquest of Grenada.
False
Granada War
Queen Isabella I of Castile and King Ferdinand II of Aragon of Spain
King Louis XI of France
King Henry VII of England
The Doge of Venice
Who sponsored the expedition of explorer Christopher Columbus?
Christopher Columbus was born in Italy.
Queen Isabella sponsors the expedition of explorer Christopher Columbus.
True
Christopher Columbus
To expel Jews from Spain
To establish Spanish as the official language of Spain
To establish a new tax system in Spain
To declare war on a neighboring country
What was the main purpose of the Alhambra Decree?
The Alhambra Decree was issued by the Catholic Monarchs of Spain in order to eliminate the influence of Jews on Spain's New Christian population.
The Alhambra Decree is issued, ordering the expulsion of Jews from Spain.
True
Alhambra Decree
It established Spain as a major European power.
It marked the beginning of the Holy Roman Empire's decline.
It led to the spread of the Catholic faith throughout Europe.
It brought about the end of the Protestant Reformation.
What was the significance of Charles I being crowned Holy Roman Emperor?
Charles V was not the head of the House of Habsburg.
Charles I is crowned Holy Roman Emperor
False
Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor
The death of the last Hapsburg king, Charles II
The death of King Philip II
The defeat of the Spanish Armada
The signing of the Treaty of Westphalia
What event is often considered to mark the end of the Spanish Golden Age?
The Spanish Golden Age was associated with the reigns of several powerful Spanish monarchs, including Isabella I and Ferdinand II.
Spanish Golden Age
True
Spanish Golden Age
Hernan Cortes
Francisco Pizarro

Who conquered the Aztecs Empire in Mexico for Spain?
Hernán Cortés was a Spanish conquistador who led an expedition that caused the fall of the Aztec Empire.
Spanish explorer Hernan Cortes conquers the Aztecs Empire in Mexico.
True
Hernán Cortés
To punish England for supporting the Dutch rebellion against Spanish rule
To convert the English to Catholicism
To seize control of the English throne
To establish a Spanish colony in England
Why did the Spanish Armada set out to invade England in 1588?
The English fleet was able to attack the Armada as it sailed up the Channel because it was faster and more manoeuvrable than the larger Spanish galleons.
The Spanish Armada is defeated by the English navy
True
Spanish Armada
His idealistic pursuit of chivalric values and his tendency to confuse reality with imagination
His talent for diplomacy and negotiation
His role as a great Spanish conqueror
His great wealth and influence on the Spanish royal court
What is the main character of "Don Quixote" known for?
"Don Quixote" was originally interpreted as a tragic novel.
Miguel de Cervantes publishes the epic novel Don Quixote.
False
Don Quixote
Religious conflict between Catholics and Protestants
Territorial disputes between France and Spain
A struggle for power between the Habsburg and Ottoman empires
A revolt against the rule of the English monarchy
What was the primary cause of the Thirty Years' War?
The Peace of Westphalia, which ended the Thirty Years' War, granted greater autonomy to states within the Holy Roman Empire.
The Thirty Years' War begins.
True
Thirty Years' War
